New Records: Steph Curry scored 31 points on 22 shots, tying his season high with 8 three-pointers
Key Match Events: Miami's zone defense helped them hold off Golden State's offense, with Kel'el Ware showing positive moments as a rim deterrence
Jaime Jaquez Jr. and Nikola Jovic had fine evenings, helping the HEAT to a 114-98 win
A back-and-forth fourth quarter saw Miami pull away with a 10-point lead
Pre-Game Insights: Miami's zone defense was expected to be a key factor in the game, but it was also noted that teams have to create their own luck and make their own shots
Post-Match Reflections: Steve Kerr waved the white flag and pulled his starters with three minutes to play, acknowledging that the night was in the HEAT's hands
Erik Spoelstra's decision to sit back in zone for most of the night paid off, earning the HEAT a win
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at the Chase Center in San Francisco
The HEAT ended their brief losing streak with the win
Others: Jaime Jaquez Jr.'s driving game was highlighted as an impressive part of his sophomore season
Nikola Jovic's size and passing ability were noted as exciting aspects of his game
